jobDescription: Employee Type: Seasonal/Temp Location: Dallas, TX Job Type: Policy Operations Experience: Not Specified Date Posted:6/10/2018Job DescriptionEssential Duties and Responsibilities: Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.  Assist management on quality assurance programs, as well as special requests.  Independently plan, design, perform all aspects for quality assurance testing following departmental standards and procedures, including walkthrough of processes, setting objectives, defining scope, designing tests and performing the quality assurance testing.  Perform risk assessments, including identification, evaluation, and documentation of business risks, policies, procedures, and controls.  Analyze quality assurance evidence to provide management with an evaluation of the adequacy of compliance with financial and operational policies, procedures, and controls and make recommendations for improvement.  Communicate effectively with all levels of management; to ensure full understanding of objectives, risks, controls, and observations.  Prepare clear and concise quality assurance reports and other communications.  Complete ad hoc projects as requested by management.  Support regulatory assurances and policies, procedures, and controls testing;  Conduct quality assurance testing including compliance, financial and operational quality assurances, claims and contracting quality assurances, provider quality assurances, functional quality assurances and others as directed.  Provide support for fraud investigations.  Provide support to the corporate internal audit department for SOX audits.  Lead internal quality assurances of operations, and consult with process management on solutions.  Facilitate periodic audits system access permissions and permissible purpose for access to systems/information,  Periodic audits of access changes based on job change and/or terminations.  Periodic access review of our TPA's system access.  Work independently on quality assurance engagements.  Prepare working papers and written quality assurances reports.  Hold preliminary discussions of quality assurance results with business partners to verify facts and discuss recommendations. This includes attending meetings with all levels of management; to ensure full understanding of objectives, risks, controls, and observations.  Appraise the adequacy of the corrective action taken and work collaboratively with business partners to assist in developing business process changes to address recommendations.  data mining technology to quality assurances/projects.  Support the implementing of an annual quality assurance plan. Minimum Skills and Competencies: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. College Degree or equivalent education, training and work-related experience  5-10 years of experience in health insurance with experience in internal quality assurance, internal audit, public accounting or regulatory compliance.  Ability to work on multiple, concurrent projects, as part of a team or independently, and research, understand, and evaluate the company's operations, rules and regulations.  Demonstrate a high level of personal integrity and reflect an appropriate level of judgment, maturity, and confidentiality.
